website_summaries.verdict: Minor quirks aside, if you are looking for a reusable K-Cup made especially for Keurigs, this is a durable model by the popular brand that has fewer issues than its competitors.
pros: A revamped model by Keurig, the original manufacturer of K-Cup coffee brewers
Makes it easy to adjust coffee portions for mild to strong brews once you learn how to use it
Fits the majority of Keurig coffee makers – 2.0/1.0
cons: Has a bit of a learning curve, especially if you are use to the older model
Despite being universal, some owners of older Keurigs complained it didn't fit properly

customer_reviews.title: NOT for all Keurigs
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT work on all Keurigs. If you have the earlier ones (like the one pictured) it is too tall. It even pictures my model in the instructions to remove an adapter, but it does not work for my model.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Roddy

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit the K mini plus that is on sale everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: At the Keurig website they explain this will work with the mini and the min plus when you remove the bottom piece. Theere were photos. So we ordered it. NO IT DOES NOT FIT. We will return the K mini plus because you cannot use your own coffee and must use disposable plastic. We have tried another type of filter, but it did not work either.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: It works but You may want to find a video how to use THIS device
customer_reviews.text: Look for the video to use this. I was dumbfounded until I saw the video. You have to take the cup that holds the K-cup out of your machine first before putting this one in. To take the cup out of your machine (I used this on the Keurig K-Cafe Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee, Latte and Cappuccino) by GENTLY pushing the cup out from the compartment from the underside. Open the device where you put your KCup, put your finger underneath (where the coffee comes out) and gently push the cup contraption up and the small cup will pop out. You then place this Universal KCup in with the grounds and use as normally.
customer_reviews.author: SpiralD

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the butt
customer_reviews.text: This version is a pain compared to previous versions. There are now more pieces to wash, it has a bump on the bottom so it does not sit on the counter (it tips over), and it triggers a new menu that requires more selections than before. Overall it's a hassle. Not a huge hassle but enough such that I am returning it even though it didn't cost a lot to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Be4me

customer_reviews.title: CROOKS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my cup holder and it did not fit. Called them and was told to return it and order the replacement for the k cups, Did that the order part. I am now told it will cost me more to return it to them then it cost me. I am not willing to pay that much. so I will most likely just toss it.
customer_reviews.author: hairnone

customer_reviews.title: NOT for all keurigs
customer_reviews.text: This product does not fit ALL keurig machines as advertised, which was very misleading. It fits Keurig 2.0. Not the single k-cup with milk frother. Just buyer beware. I am going to return, but what a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: runner27

customer_reviews.title: No on model B60
customer_reviews.text: Just want to say this does not work on model B60 and I was told by the seller it does. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit all models of Keurig
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't remotely fit in the model of Keurig in my office. Admittedly, I don't know what the model in my office is -- there's nothing obvious on it -- but the product description for this implies that it should fit in anything that uses K-cups. Eleven bucks isn't that bad, and I suppose it's on me for buying anything without confirming that it works for the exact model number I want to use it in, but it's a complete waste for me.
customer_reviews.author: Liz M.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Perfectly - Keurig K-Mini Plus Single Serve Pod
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly with my Keurig K-Mini Plus Single Serve Pod Coffee Maker. The filter has two fill lines - one for a cup and another for the travel mug brew size. It's easy to use and clean. For the mini plus, you need to remove the adapter, and the original filter that comes with the coffee maker. I love it. Makes a great cup of coffee, saves money and is less wasteful than using pods. This filter is just to make coffee, it is not recommended for hot chocolate or tea.
customer_reviews.author: Succinct  Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made but.. . .
customer_reviews.text: . . . . this will NOT work with the Keurig Mini Plus machine. It is too tall (and this is with the adapter removed). I watched the instructional video and it only shows the larger machines (classic and plus), not this smaller Keurig. I will be returning this immediately since it will not work. No sense keeping it if I won't be using it.
customer_reviews.author: StitcherSC

customer_reviews.title: Nice But Not Useable
customer_reviews.text: This does not fit my Keureg at all yet was stated it would fit. I cannot use it. Did not bother to return as it was inexpensive. It is in my cupboard. Who knows? Maybe fit another Keureg in future?
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Rayner

customer_reviews.title: Used it twice
customer_reviews.text: This item worked just fine the first time. The second time I noticed a strange smell coming from the fresh cup of coffee. The taste was the same as the smell. I traced the smell to the plastic this filter is made of. I tried the second one and the same thing happened. I soaked them in cold water all night and the smell and the taste were the same. Can't use these things, at least for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: I have a B60 model. In the questions section manufacturer clearly states that this product works with my mode. IT DOES NOT! the instruction booklet even has the exact picture of my model. So this manufacturer is deceptive. Not sure why you would want to deceive people. I will NEVER buy another product from them. Guess they are just out for a quick buck like so many others. Besides, you will be out of business soon after Amazon steals you product data and makes their own products which you won't be able to compete with. Enjoy your short lived business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Kuerig Elite
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the claim to work with all Kuerig eg; Elite , so they are just sitting the box. Not amused
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Wrong menu triggered
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of these my k-cups and all of the ones i got new at the store trigger the favorites menu where i go in and select 12oz strong and have a perfect cup of coffee. I purchased 2 more here online so i could make cups back to back and not get burned. The problem here is all the ones i got here have a "lighter colored menu dot" which triggers the standard 6, 8, 10 oz cup. It works but i don't get the options that i like. It seems to just be a fading issue or it was a batch made incorrectly. either way they don't work as well as my old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Werebunnies

customer_reviews.title: Not REALLY “universal” and it absolutely won’t fit in “all Keurigs”.
customer_reviews.text: This product says “fits ALL Keurigs” and that it’s “universal”. It was also included in the “frequently purchased together” section. It doesn’t fit in my Keurig. My boss has a larger version of the Keurig, and it’s too big for hers too. I even tried it without the bottom portion that it says has to be taken off for some models. Disappointing, but cheap enough that it’s not worth paying to ship back. If I can’t find anyone with a Keurig that it will fit...it will end up in the garbage. Just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mathews

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving this a three because they added an extra ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a three because they added an extra piece and made the inner basket where you place your grounds more flimsy and in my point of view less durable. I personally would buy the older version again as they were more durable and you don't have to mess with the 3rd piece. The only reason I had to buy this is because after two years of daily use the lid broke on my quality one.
customer_reviews.author: Flip Blaschko

customer_reviews.title: "Universal" does not mean it fits all models
customer_reviews.text: Keurig only sells one "universal" adapter to use a permanent filter and it is a pain is the neck. First it's hard to figure out, I had to YouTube around before I found good instructions. The filter does not hold securely, and you wind up with coffee grinds in your cup. Keurig would be better off making a model specific adapter instead of one size fits all. I mean you must buy an adapter anyway. I'm switching back to the drip cone method.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: works, but at what cost
customer_reviews.text: yes, it's better than throwing away plastic kcups and destroying our environment, but god this thing is so annoying to use. you have to replace the bit inside the machine that fits kcups to use it, and then you have to go wash it out every time you use it (which gets tedious if you drink coffee every morning), and the coffee ends up tasting different than normal pods. hard to describe how, but even good starbucks brand coffee tastes worse than walmart kcups when i use it. feels like bits of coffee grounds are slipping through it. there must be a better solution out there.
customer_reviews.author: tyler h

customer_reviews.title: Despite "Universal" claim, does NOT work in a K3000SE commercial machine
customer_reviews.text: At work they installed a Keurig K3000SE machine; this is a commercial unit that gets plumbed in to a filtered water line. Work does not provide the pods; just the machine. Unfortunately, this thing simply doesn't work at all in a commercial machine. I knew from using the machine with regular pods that it dumps the used pods into a waste bin, and that if it did work I would have to dig it out, but that's really not a problem, the tray pulls right out and it would be on top - but you can't make this fit. At all. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Matt McCann

customer_reviews.title: Wish Keurig gave better instructions!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a K80 and was looking all over for a reusable filter. I like making my own coffee and saves a ton of money on top of a lot less waste of the disposable cups. This filter states it fits all K-Cup machines. What they fail to state is you have to remove the current cup in the maker to put this in. I wish I would have known that before purchasing a different filter. This works as expected with my K80, with no error messages. I get strong coffee and no slug in the cup. That actually really pertains to the coffee brand more so then the filter anyway.
customer_reviews.author: RFMK Fan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well with my K-Mini Plus
customer_reviews.text: Is very hard to get in and out of the brewer. When you try to remove it, the adapter ring comes off in the bottom of the filter area which you have to dig out with your fingers. VERY hard to get the filter into the machine and it makes a very loud pop when it finally goes. TWICE as hard to get out. This is my second one of these. The first one purchased through Keurig and the only problem with that one is that (again) the adapter ring comes off in the machine. Otherwise it works fine. Very disappointed in Keurig. Com'on guys. This isn't rocket science.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Eventhough it says that it works with the Keurig 2.0, this filter did not work at all with my machine. Don't know why, but it makes this purchase a waste of money. Otherwise cleanup would be easy since you are using a paper filter, which also means that you have less grounds in your coffee. Judging by its size I would assume that the flavor of the coffee will be nice and strong. Too bad it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen L

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in my Keurig Compact K K-35
customer_reviews.text: Bought this filter to use with my wife's favorite decaf. I was hesitant at first as I was not sure it would fit my Keurig Compact-K, model K-35. Once I received it, all I had to do was remove the original K-cup adapter in my machine and drop in the My K Cup filter. Works great! On very fine grind coffees, there is some residue, however that doesn't bother us. We have been using the filter for a couple of months on a daily basis, and it is durable. Cleans up easy.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement over the earlier model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reusable coffee filter to replace the earlier model which broke after a couple of years of use. I’m happy to report that this filter is an improvement over the older model. No more coffee grinds escape & very little sludge in the bottom of my cup. My chief reason for using a reusable filter isn’t cost, but environmental. My daughter had told me that the inventor of the k-cup seriously regretted his invention because of the negative environmental impact of millions of non-biodegradable k-cups ending up in landfills. I do use a coarse grind of coffee, and find it works best.
customer_reviews.author: Dreas

customer_reviews.title: bad design but it works
customer_reviews.text: it is not clear how to put it. so you end up turning it try, turning it try. then when you find the exact spot it goes it, it is not secure, very loose. The first time used it i really thought i did something wrong. But that's it, just bad design. Oh and bonus, the grounds find a way into the cup somehow. I have tried everything and still get grounds in my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: John West

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT KEURIG MACHINES, NO RETURNS ACCEPTED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to use in our office Keurig machine. The description said it would fit ALL Keurigs, and from the photos, it looked like it would. I ordered two of these. They arrived, I brought them to the office, and lo and behold, they don't fit. I tried to return this via Amazon and the message was that they are unable to be returned. Buyer beware, even though this is manufactured by Keurig, it won't fit all the machines.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and definitely fits the minis
customer_reviews.text: I have the mini and mini+ and this works fantastic with them. You just have to make sure you pop out the "holder" in your mini. To do this, you open the lid, put your hand under the spout and then push up. Once that pops out, you can fit this into its spot. I find that the "minimum" line of coffee is a little weak in flavor so I usually fill it to the top line. Love this little thing. Saves a lot of money too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work in my two Keurig 2.0 machines.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps this fits all currently produced Keurig 1.0 and 2.0, But it does NOT work on my two Keurig 2.0 machines which are different models. In both, the pod will only bring up the carafe menu. This is useless to me. Amazon’s information is false.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Macbain

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with Keurig 2.0 as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 of these. Thought first might just be defective. Didn't check others until recently needed them. All look similar to the other Keurig Universal Filters I have that work. However when I place them in the Keurig, I only get the options to choose: 4, 8, 10, 12. I don't get the options to choose the circled numbers and choose "2" for mugs as I would have expected. Rechecked the description and packaging and both say compatible with all Keurig brewers. Unfortunatley checked them too late to return so stuck with five filters that I can's use with my larger mugs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: So many parts, I DO NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: There are 4 parts to each of these. Takes so long to find them all, put all together, clean them and you need to do this with every use. What a pain. Typical of Keurig. Too big of company who has lost their way on ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Less mess than the older version. Makes YUMMY Lattes in the new K Cafe with the Supreme Bustelo Espresso style coffee. No need for Starbucks.. this is way better. And for all the reviewers saying it does not work for their model they are not removing the K cup holder (clearly from the photos they are posting on their reviews). I have had several models and it fits in them all. Check out YouTube if you need more help removing the k cup holder or their is a video that is posted in the reviews also.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina F.

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with 2.0 brewer
customer_reviews.text: This does not work with my Keurig 2.0 brewer. I get the message not compatible with my brewer. I purchased one from Amazon last month which works fine. Seller refunded me $5.00 and not full price for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Iced Coffee function doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.text: The ice tea function does not work as easy as it should. The coffee tastes terrible and the process is not easy. I wouldn't every buy this product again for use related to Iced Coffee. The buttons are easy to see, but it will not always do the coffee right away. I had to open and close the lid several times for the lights to shine for me to press the size of drink I wanted. The product looks good, but overall was not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Easy & saves a lot of $$$
customer_reviews.text: On work mornings, we love the convenience of our Keurig because we drink different things and over 2 hours apart. Now that we can pack our own kcups, we are back to buying better quality coffees and using our on burr grinder saving a LOT OF $$$ and enjoying flavors so much more. We still want our French Press on weekends but love the ease of the work week mornigs with kcups. In addition, we hated the waste that kcups present...we just compost our grinds, wash out the kcup unit and reuse. We have 4 now and life is a little easier as we do our part for the planet
customer_reviews.author: Spa Mama

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best reusable pod that I ever bought, and I have tried quite a few...
customer_reviews.author: claudia moss

customer_reviews.title: So-so, you win and you lose some
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Of all the reusable k-cups we have tried, this one gets the flavor right! We want to reduce our plastic waste, but at the same time we want the coffee to taste like coffee. The only downside is having to take the needle compartment out of the machine to fit this giant cup. Some days, it’s not worth the hassle before the first cup of coffee! We would purchase again though. When you want a special grind of coffee you can’t find in a k-cup brand, you’ll reach for this little buddy.
customer_reviews.author: killahpandah

customer_reviews.title: saves money AND plastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my new, reusable k-cup! I have an older model that was gifted to me during Christmas of 2012 and this product fits inside the device. I had been using the reusable k-cup that came with the Keurig, but the mesh lining ripped over time, so grounds were making their way into my cup of joe (or 6) each morning. This newer k-cup, though, shoots the water through the grounds even faster than the old one, and there's hardly any "sludge" at the bottom. Easy to clean and wash. 10/10 would recommend! Worth every penny -- buy yourself a coffee grinder if you don't have one and stop using one-time-use plastic k-cups that hurt our environment!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: DOES. NOT. FIT. KEURIG. ELITE
customer_reviews.text: Can't rate the product on if it works or not, BECAUSE IT DOES NOT FIT. This doesn't fit the Keurig Elite. Just wanted to write a review to help out someone else. Get the grey ones with the screw-on top for the Keurig Elite. Hope you don't waste time like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Williams

customer_reviews.title: The Cheaper Alternative To K-Cups
customer_reviews.text: As much as I love the ease of K-cups, I hate the price that goes with them. This is an insanely cheap option for me to drink some of the coffee that I love for half the price. I have had it for a while now, and it works great! It's fairly easy to clean too. I can clean it in the time it takes my Keurig to heat up in the morning. Highly recommend if you want to save some money, or don't like excess waste!
customer_reviews.author: fenderguy91r

customer_reviews.title: Half price and free shipping!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t received it yet but it’s half the price of Keurig.com. And when I contacted Keurig on two occasions and both times received a form letter saying there is no reusable coffee filters for a commercial coffee maker so I can use my own coffee. But my Seller was able to contact a Keurig representative who told my Seller that this one does indeed work. For $14.99 plus postage. For one. I’m very Happy to buy this one so I bought two at half the price and even got free shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the attached piece!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a K-Mini plus and it says the extra piece needs to be attached to be able to use it in "plus" machines...long story short, you have to force it in the pod holder and when it's time to take it out, it's stuck! By time you get it out, the extra piece has broken off...every single time. My machine holds the cup fine without the extra piece, so I ended up throwing that piece away because it was not worth the trouble. Other than that, I love it and use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Patti P

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay for about a month...
customer_reviews.text: Re-usable pods are a good idea to save money and they work for the most part...but after about a month of usage and normal washing, the pod would consistently come undone and spill coffee grinds into my coffee. I thought I was overpacking the pod so be careful when you do that, but even when I was very cautious, it would happen more times than not on this pod. I'd give it a shot but look out for that after some time. I bought a different brand elsewhere and have not had the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hung N.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Overall Cup of Coffee - Either Too Weak or a Cup of Mud
customer_reviews.text: The filter is somewhat annoying to insert into some Keurig Machines because a piece of plastic in the machine has to be removed in order for the filter to fit. Regarding the quality of the coffee, I tried several different beans and grind levels, but no matter which coffee/grind combination was used the result was either too strong or extremely weak with a significant amount of grounds ultimately ending up in the cup. I do not recommend this product unless someone has figured out the perfect grind size and amount of coffee to use in the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: If you read the directions, it's a simple to use product that helps save the environment.
customer_reviews.text: I don't drink a lot of coffee, but I like to have a cup, which the Keurig comes in handy for. I decided that I'm not going to buy those disposable k-cups anymore and just use this reusable one from now on. and it works great. If you just read the instruction on how to use it (which I'm guessing most of the people complaining on here didn't) it just works. you put your coffee in the reusable filter and put it in the specific base that comes with it and it spits out hot coffee.
customer_reviews.author: fp3

customer_reviews.title: Best reusable Kcup yet!
customer_reviews.text: Very good, but with a caveat. The mesh filter is improved in that it has mesh on the bottom. However, to mimic the function of a disposable Kcup, I use a paper filter and make sure there is plenty overlap with the unit. Then, when the top is applied, it seals the filter. Makes for easy cleanup and pretty close function to a disposable Kcup. I liked it so well, I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: ObiWan

customer_reviews.title: Close but not quite
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars but it just didn't extend the way I needed it to for my one big pot. If I forced it, it would have gouged out the inside of my pot and I paid plenty for them. It also was not the easiest to close once opened all the way. So readjusting may be an issue for those who decide to keep it. Overall, it arrived quickly and was what I expected but just was of no use to me because of the size of one of my pots.
customer_reviews.author: Tiphani

customer_reviews.title: Works well in our Keurig Compact
customer_reviews.text: The instructions that came with this product were general, which I suppose is fine for most users. There were no instructions provided with our Keurig itself, or this product, that covered how to remove the pre-installed K-Cup holder, so that we could install this. (Spoiler: you can push up from the bottom, but be careful for sharp needles!) After we figured out how to install it, it works well and is easy enough to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t what I had expected
customer_reviews.text: My original intention was to use this with the coffee I already had and not the k-cups. My K-Cafe came in when it was supposed to, but this universal k-cup took four more days... so I had to buy the regular k-cups at the store and I got a few flavors. When the universal k-cup came in I tried it and wasn’t impressed. It is a mess to clean up and I don’t want to get any leftover coffee grounds in my disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to cut back on k-cup use because all of the trash we are creating with them so I'm using my reusable filter and just purchased this new version as a back up to my original one. Works pretty well. Eventually, even if you are dishwashing the 'basket' the metal mesh seems to clog up with the fine coffee dust and then I wonder if the coffee is coming through like it should so I guess we just have to plan on buying new filters every so often (maybe twice a year?).
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Old Design Was Better
customer_reviews.text: This is the second generation of Kcups I've bought and the older design I had was better than these. The baskets in these come out, which in theory was a better design, but in reality, it makes a much flimsier and lower quality product than its predecessor. I have only used them for 2 or 3 rounds of coffee and I already have noticed how much more flimsy these are. I think there is a better design in the works that is as sturdy as the old design but also allows you to take the basket out? Maybe? I don't know, but if I have a choice, I'll buy the old ones all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly R.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK FOR K575 MODEL
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that I would be able to use it with my K575 because it says on the description that it works for ALL 2.0 versions to include 500 series. DOES NOT WORK. The machine does not recognize the pod, so you cannot use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Strong Brew!
customer_reviews.text: I like to buy loose coffee as well as grind beans but was always unhappy with how weak my coffee was. I was using the less expensive gray one. This is soooo much better. The old one used to let water flow outside the filter and made a mess (not to mention very weak coffee). It took me a while to get used to the cap but now I can do it with my eyes closed. Easy to rinse for daily use and then every so often I throw it in the dishwasher when I run a load. I didn’t need the extra piece for other Keurig models. Read the directions and you won’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: marie a. george

customer_reviews.title: I never give 5 stars. This product is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Works Great!! Great way to save money. Allows you to buy your favorite loose coffee on sale and brew it in your Keurig. Very easy to use. cleaning is as easy as dumping the coffee in the trash and rinsing the three pieces under running water. Wash with soap and water once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Screen

customer_reviews.title: Here's the thing....
customer_reviews.text: So we had a Kuerig and worried about our carbon foot print/the money we spent on K cups. Honestly, this was a pain to load for one cup, it's a pain to clean, it's annoying when you want more than one cup of coffee. It really eliminates the benefit of convenience of the Kuerig. Every other member of my family could never understand how it works so like 65% of the time you end up with a cup of coffee grounds. We went back to a coffee pot, it's just easier. If you have kids or a life good luck with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dayne evenson

customer_reviews.title: Keurig company is not helpful but product is fine
customer_reviews.text: So either the keurig company is stupid and has no idea what they are talking about or...well that's it. I have a keurig 2.0 and they told me to take out the entire coffee filter holder thing so this product could flop around and not properly dispense coffee. I ignored them and now I have to push the pointy thing inside of the machine to the side to put this in. However, once I did that this product worked great. It makes great coffee, easy to clean, annoying and can be a little dangerous to put into the machine itself. Keurig really needs to fix this or explain it better.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mesnick

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I bought the genuine article
customer_reviews.text: I am really glad I paid for the real-deal reusable K-cup. I could see that the knock-off ones were not great, according to reviews. I found this very easy to use (good set of directions), and I LOVE the coffee it makes; it's stronger than when I use a disposable k-cup because I fill the cup to the highest line. I'm setting the rinsed out k-cup in the carousel of disposable ones so that it can dry out for my next cup.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Lots of moving parts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to reduce waste, which it works great for. However, when you get to the bottom of your coffee, there is what I call “sludge”. I usually have to make a couple ounces more than I will actually drink because the bottom is unpleasant. Coffee particles get stiff in the bottom of the mesh filter and it seems impossible to clean out. The lettering, “instructions” have faded. It is a little obnoxious to take all apart, but I do it to reduce waste.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Foster

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money! It does not work!
customer_reviews.text: This k-cup reusable pod is garbage. It worked maybe 3 times before the top came off and spewed coffee grinds all over the place. The power from the water shooting into the pod is to powerful for the flimsy locking mechanism on the top. If you own the Elite Kureg, buy the Grey Reusable Pod with the screw down top. It works great with no problems. If this review helps you, please click HELPFUL. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Executive Director of WindowsHD

customer_reviews.title: I can finally make a mug size beverage without annoying messages
customer_reviews.text: I chose a model of Keurig mainly because it make all sizes of coffee, then had trouble finding the mug pods. Don't think anyone even makes them anymore, but now I can use this function again. I also use mine for hot tea. Determined correct amount by using the same measurement in a tea bag. Uses a much smaller amount of tea leaves than you would think. Empty the contents as soon as possible to make cleaning easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rabid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Reusable K Cup
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have two now. Thought I ought to have a back up for the old one I have had for several years. I can use regular coffee for the large pots in the mornings and it is much cheaper than the pods and we aren't filling up the garbage with the pods. I use the coffee grounds after making coffee on my rose bush and that has made my roses bloom all summer and the plant looks really healthy this year!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If I'm being honest I would have purchased the knock off brand before I bought these.
customer_reviews.text: Why? Because the Non-Keurig brand is ridiculously cheaper and the pods do the exact same job. Do yourself a favor and buy cheaper knock off brands instead. These Keurig Pods work great and I've had no problem in my MINI. I just had to pull off the main piece that way it could fit. But the other pods do the same job with the same quality. Save yourself a few bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Maddeh

customer_reviews.title: Save Money!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I would buy again no problem. Makes great cup of coffee. Easy to use. I took one star because every now and then it’s not recognized by the K machine. Tried to figure out why but doesn’t happen enough to stop using it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince D.

customer_reviews.title: Error message when using on kuerig 2.0
customer_reviews.text: I have used this k-cup on my kuerig 2.0 a handful of times with no problems. But this morning I continued to get an error that “this cup was not designed for this machine.” I tried it multiple times and even turned the kuerig off and on again a couple times and to no avail I continued to get the same error. Instead I had to go out and spend $6 on coffee on my way to work. I am not happy that I have only had this for a few months and it is already failing.
customer_reviews.author: Kiera T

customer_reviews.title: Works great and has the advanced options that I like!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed on how much this has helped in making my coffee in the morning. Not just because I can use any coffee I want now, without paying for a lot of extra trash to throw away after each use. The advanced options were a little tricky to learn at first but now I can do a lot of other types of brews that I could not with premade pods! I really hope to be able to catch these in stock again to buy another 1 or 2 for extras!
customer_reviews.author: Jw

customer_reviews.title: Had to file down to fit mini plus
customer_reviews.text: Does not work in mini plus. No matter how I tried this it didn’t work. If someone knows a magically way to get it to fit please let me know. ***Update 3/15*** Took the adapter piece off and still wouldn’t fit I had to file down the plastic piece a bit that attaches to the adapter to get it to fit flush. Changed from 1 star to 4 bc now it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mortisha

customer_reviews.title: Price gouging
customer_reviews.text: I love mine. Four stars overall except for cleaning. I hate getting the grounds out so I wanted a second one so it doesn't have to be cleaned between my and my husband's morning cup if coffee so I went to order a new one. Suddenly, the price is nearly 3 times what i paid for it before. So disgusted. A filter for $22 that should be $8. As a consistent Amazon customer that orders multiple times a week, this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to using K Cups
customer_reviews.text: I find K Cups to be very expensive and not recycle friendly. My husband had purchased a knock off version of this, but it was only the basket part. It didn't work that well and made my coffee taste weak. Normally I say knock off products are just as good, but in this case I will only buy the K Cup version. Only problem and it's a slight problem is that the wire for the basket is a little flimsy, easily bent if not careful. But other than that it's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: JLuvBug

customer_reviews.title: Yes it works with Keurig Cafe
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with the Keurig Cafe. Need to remove piece in cafe (easy if you push it up from underneath) and replace with this. Easy to clean and works a lot better than any other cup we’ve tried which left a mess behind. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TBordFL

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT universal & does NOT fit all Keurigs
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT “universal” and does NOT fit all Keurig coffee makers! I have an older machine and it’s too tall, it doesn’t fit. Totally misleading description! Now I have to take time out of my extremely busy schedule to deal with returning it. What a pain. CHANGE THE DESCRIPTION!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Works Perfect in my Keurig K-Elite K Single Serve K-Cup Pod Maker. I ended up buying 2. Makes a great up of coffee from my favorites ground coffees, better the that Keurig Donut Shop Pods I was using, they gave me problems. I opened one of them up and used it in the reusable pod and it worked fine. The coffee was ground finer in the pod which I didn't care for.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fengler

customer_reviews.title: It is NOT universal
customer_reviews.text: I removed the cup holder from my K-Cafe brewer and attempted to insert the reusable filter. Short of forcing it in and risking not being able to remove it, it absolutely does not fit. If you have a K-cafe brewer, don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Latimer

customer_reviews.title: NOT for all Keurig
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to buy this reusable filter since I drink a lot of coffee. I was so excited when I finally received my package, I ripped open the package to try it out. To my horror, it does NOT fit. It's too tall. I thought I was doing something wrong, so I check on Amazon reviews, and it is a known issue. What the hell Amazon. How, and why are you allowing sellers to lie to the consumers?
customer_reviews.author: oznew

customer_reviews.title: Not sure...
customer_reviews.text: So the little clip piece on the bottom/outside needs to come off in order for this to work with the Elite brewer. The clip attachment is needed for the Plus series brewers. No mess, no hot water squirting all over. Only made one cup so far, and it seems like it's kind of weak. This even after using the Strong setting. I'll give this some more tries and hopefully it will brew stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, leaks with Keurig Classic
customer_reviews.text: I prefer my own locally roasted coffee so I thought this device would enable me to use this coffee with with Keurig. I read some reviews about how it leaks and doesn't fit properly but the brochure said it was compatible with the classic Keurig. Well, once it starts the hot water spews out the top and you end up with a weak coffee. Maybe if the container had a bigger hole on top to match the holes created in the pods it might have been better. Anyway, it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the earlier model
customer_reviews.text: These reusable Kuerig K-cup filters are a big improvement over the earlier model I bought. This one has a removable filter basket, making it easier to clean that the earlier version. I also will accommodate more coffee, so you can use is to make your coffee in a travel mug (I have made up to 12 oz of coffee with it). I can't justify buying the K-cup single use coffee pods. They are much more expensive than refilling your own filter (and how lazy can you get, anyway?)
customer_reviews.author: D. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Does not fit correctly!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer BEWARE! Too tall. Must remove pieces of machine to use. Other filters on Amazon work better without adjusting machine. Why Keurig decided to make their version so difficult I can't figure out, but if you use it you cannot easily go back and forth with regular pods. Ridiculous. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Miami, FL

customer_reviews.title: keurig universal reusable coffee filter
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this idea and am very glad that they make this instead of forcing people to only have to buy the pods for this machine. I bought for not only myself but for the family who is set on the types of coffee they use and won't use anything else and so I am glad that I bought it so they can also use my Keurig machine and am glad that I did. I think this would come in great handy for all Keurig users and think everyone should have one also.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: My K Cup with... bad directions
customer_reviews.text: The products does exactly as described. If you have a Keurig classic there are directions to help fit this bad boy into your coffee maker. However, the directions assume you know what everything is called on your Keurig. I personally did not know. I ended up looking up a tutorial on YouTube. After trying with the directions for 45 minutes and failing. It took me 2 minutes of watching a video to see how quick and easy this contraption really works. It’s super easy to clean. The coffee tastes good from it. Other than those directions this is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamen

customer_reviews.title: Stupid
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit keurig. Has a lock and unlock and just unnecessary features. Not a fan at all. Its super extra. I just need to brew coffee lol. Update: i did try all the methods and it still does not fit
customer_reviews.author: Scootaloo

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was just a basket with an attached lid
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what Keurig was thinking when designing their own adapter - ugh. I am intelligent and quick to learn things, and this contraption was needlessly over complicated. Once I finally got it to work, I just continue to wonder why .... where was any forethought that went into this adapter? Just baffles my brain at the lengths they went to in order to confuse and complicate such a simple idea. I will be ordering the simple adapter that is made for my Keurig Mini and throw this in the trash, which is what Keurig should have done when they invented this thing....
customer_reviews.author: txgirly

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit the B40
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model (2014?) B40 and this will not fit. I wanted this for the larger basket (more coffee!) and luckily the basket fit inside another housing unit I already owned, which came with a small basket. So, I solved my problem, but only on sheer luck of owning the other unit to mate it with. Also, bought it on sale during Prime Days, so not unhappy with the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Candice P

customer_reviews.title: Efficient!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was so excited when this was delivered! He said it seems to make his coffee stronger and it’s super easy to clean. If you dump out the used grounds when they are still wet it’s even easier to clean. Once it dries it gets a little difficult. We have two of these and they work great! They worked for our older keurig and they work for our new one now too! It helps us save money when we need to as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Reihing

customer_reviews.title: VERY DIFFICULT TO USE
customer_reviews.text: I found this insert to be very difficult to use and in the end, could not use it. It was too late to return. Get the small purple ones instead and the paper filters. Save yourself a lot of disappointment and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Mueller

customer_reviews.title: NOT Keurig Compatible
customer_reviews.text: This is an honest non paid for non free item given review. This is not compatible with Keurig machines. We put this in our digital larger sized Keurig and it did not work. The Keurig machine said it is not compatible and the Keurig machine and didn't even let us try it. It just would not work. It may work with other coffee-pod brand machines. But not Keurig. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Bold coffee
customer_reviews.text: I like a good bold brew. Strong coffee. I finally found this k cup reusable filter and now able of making a flavorful cup of coffee. I first attempted with the cheaper mesh screen filters and was dissatisfied by the lack of taste. It is a hassle to pop out the k cup holder on my K elite everytime I want to use it but the flavor makes it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rholt

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit the Keurig K Duo Plus
customer_reviews.text: According to the product information it fits ALL Keurig brewers. In reality it does NOT fit the Keurig K Duo Plus. It is longer than the pod holder that has to be removed and does not even go into the hole straight. See the photos. It is pathetic that they make a product which they claim works with all brewers when it does not. Returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Goat

customer_reviews.title: Fits k compact k35
customer_reviews.text: I got a keurig k compact for Christmas and my old reusable pod wouldn't fit. So I bought this one . I tried to put it in like a normal pod , and it wouldn't fit . So I got on YouTube trying to figure it out . If you pop out the bottom needle this pod fits perfectly . . 2 packets of instructions won't tell you this easy fix
customer_reviews.author: savannah

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This item was recommended by you guys with the coffee maker I purchased at the same time , This item does not go with this coffeemaker no way does it fit , I’m very disappointed in you guys that you recommended an item that does not go with the coffee maker that I purchased from you guys , I will never ever do that again too bad I will have to do my own homework on items that you guys recommend together. Very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Saves lots of money.
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I got this was to save money. This official Keurig product is far better than a generic reusable cup that I tried before. No grounds in the coffee anymore, but you do get more sediment than with a K cup. More work/less convenient than K cups, of course, but the savings are well worth the little bit of effort to clean and refill this cup.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Great cup with no grounds!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I finally got the Keurig reusable K-Cup brand! I have been using the fake reusable cup for the longest time and I was always having to change them out. My new Keurig also started to not recognize them and would end the cup in the middle. I finally got this and I’m so happy I did! Super easy to clean l and fill and makes a strong cup of coffee! Totally made a difference!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Given other reviews, I thought this would work better than it does. I have had trouble with other reusable cups because the water goes through the coffee way too fast and my coffee is too weak. This one is no different, the water still goes through too quickly and my coffee is weak. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jbro

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT ALL KEURIG COFFEE MAKERS
customer_reviews.text: The produce looks well made and it might work, but not with our Keurig K-Cup machine. Utterly useless. So, for the product maker, don't say things that are not true. Not expensive enough to merit sending back.
customer_reviews.author: A. Y. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you add a magnet to your 2.0-k200
customer_reviews.text: Does not allow for brewing 14-16oz as is. My old red dot worked for travel mugs but this only allows for 6-8 oz. a quick search found a few hacks that I tried. The one that worked was supergluing a little magnet to the cup holder. I had a 3/16 by 3/16 about 1/16 thick that i used. It has to be facing the right way so try before you glue it down
customer_reviews.author: U. Jonsson

customer_reviews.title: Totally get it!
customer_reviews.text: So I prefer old fashioned coffee machines, but my boyfriend prefers his fancy Keurig. However, buying the K-Cup refills from Starbucks can get expensive real fast. So to compromise we got this, I still have my old fashioned coffee maker in a sense and we can still use his fancy Keurig machine. Works great. We did have to take the outercase casing off to make it fit into our machine, but it works amazing. Easy to clean, we just rinse it after every use to avoid buildup. Get it, won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hunker

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: These save me a lot of money. One trick is if your Keurig has a strong setting you can run it normally through the coffee once & use the same grounds on strong a second time. (Strong soaks longer.) This is important, because how a Keurig works causes you to need more coffee grounds in this than comparative to a cup from a full coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: Woundheir

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Keurig only not the after market
customer_reviews.text: We are using this pod with our new Keurig mini. Very happy with it, at first we bought the after market reusable K-cup pod from the local big store which was the headache and waste of the time. You have to buy the Keurig brand to be happy. Also you have to pour little bit more coffee in to this pod to have really tasteful cup
customer_reviews.author: Milos

customer_reviews.title: Defective Design Needs to be Fixed
customer_reviews.text: This device does not snap tight enough. During a brew the lid separates from the rear of the holder, allowing grinds and water to spill out and make a mess. I have two of these and they both leak. The problem is that the lid flanges are too shallow to secure the lid on the holder when clicked into place. It is simply a bad design, with badly designed tolerances and poor injection molding. Fire the mechanical engineering team that produced this piece of junk holder for such an otherwise expensive machine. No excuse for this.
customer_reviews.author: Metrinom

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks
customer_reviews.text: We decided that paying for K-Cup coffee canisters was becoming way too expensive. This little device is awesome. We spend less on coffee, and still get to use our Keurig machine! There's no difference in taste between using this and K-Cups - if anything, I think using coffee fresh from the bag seems to taste fresher! We throw it in the dishwasher once in a while, and it cleans nicely. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B.

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with K-Mini Plus CORRECTION
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my Keurig K-Mini Plus so I could use my own coffee - not a pod. It was not compatible so I had to return it. It didn't fit, the description said it would! I MADE A MISTAKE!!! After looking at a video on YouTube, I see there was a piece I was supposed to remove before attaching this item. I plan to reorder and try again.
customer_reviews.author: Netta D

product_meta.title: Keurig My K-Cup Universal Reusable K-Cup Pod Coffee Filter, Compatible with All 2.0 Keurig K-Cup Pod Coffee Makers, 1 Count, Black
product_meta.description: The Keurig My K-Cup universal reusable filter is a simple and convenient way to brew your favorite ground Coffee using your Keurig Coffee maker. Now, in addition to hundreds of delicious varieties of K-Cup pods, you can enjoy an even bigger assortment of Coffee. The Keurig My universal reusable filter is the only reusable coffee filter approved for use in all Keurig K-Cup Coffee makers. Brewing your favorite ground Coffee is easier than ever; just fill the My K-Cup reusable filter to one of the two fill lines, then pop it into your Keurig Coffee maker and in no time, you’ll be enjoying a cup of hot, delicious Coffee. The Keurig My K-Cup universal reusable filter is optimized for both cup and travel mug brew sizes, and the removable lid makes filling and cleaning a snap. Highly durable and dishwasher safe (top rack only), the Keurig My universal reusable filter is BPA-free, and made with materials that meet the highest standards of product quality and safety.
feature_bullets: The only Keurig approved reusable filter designed for use in all Keurig home coffee makers
Includes two fill lines; Optimized for cup & travel mug brew sizes
Easy to use & easy to clean. BPA free

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars8,543 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
